Posts.Content: "I switched from a generally healthy diet to a metabolic one, focusing on alkaline over acid foods and cutting out all sugars," adds Richards. "I also cut out all grains and most fruit, which are broken down into sugars. Instead, I concentrated on leafy green vegetables, short grain rice, quinoa and linseeds, and cut out all dairy, which is pumped with artificial hormones. I also had regular high-dose infusions of vitamin C, a natural form of chemotherapy." ...........The tumors broke down and went away. Learn more:http://www.naturalnews.com/036830_breast_cancer_dietary_chan Just wanted to share
Posts.Title: A success story

Posts.Content: JUST WANT TO LET YOU KNOW That I read your Life Story....and I am sure others have also.  You have a precious 12 year old.  http://www.cancerfightingstrategies.com/oxygenation.html I found this site for cancer fighting strategies it looks good. There are so many others. My dad detoxifies his chemo brain with Essiac tea, we make it. Also Trans Resveratral. He just started using AHCC which is a mushroom that stopped his cancer from growing.
Posts.Title: metastatic disease

Posts.Content: On Jan 14, 2009 12:00 AM Shemay wrote: I just received this link today and feel it is important information that needs to be passed along........................ Researchers Singer and Grismaijer observed 4,500 women and their bra wearing practices. An amazing 3 out of 4 women who wore their bras 24 hours per day developed breast cancer. Women who wore their bras more than 12 hours per day had a 1 in 7 chance of getting breast cancer. 1 out 152 women who wore their bra less than 12 hours a day got breast cancer and an incredibly low 1 out of 168 women who rarely or never wear a bra developed breast cancer. Source: http://www.NaturalNews.com/z025315.html "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.NaturalNews.com/z025315.html " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.NaturalNews.com/z025315.html Thank you = I shared with my daughter who like to wear a bra 24 hours a day.
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: keep us all updated - there are many people on this board - My brothers girlfriend just was DX with breast cancer. - I am 49 and until my dad got cancer 4 yrs ago - I didn't realize how many people are coming down with cancer. I am going to start researching breast cancer. I have found one video of a woman who had the breast cancer on youtube - It was very interesting - and uplifting -  I am not on my computer so I don't have access to my saved files. when I find It I will post- Yaziza
